intro: Goniophlebium pectinatum, commonly known as the pectinate liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, leaf-like structures called thallus, which are typically flattened and lobed. The plant exhibits a distinctive pectinate arrangement of its leaf-like lobes, giving it a feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Goniophlebium pectinatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
